posts.cooked:
We are trying to implement YAGSL running neos with sparkmaxes and we have an issue where the robot “recoils”. When we move the joystick forward and then let go, it stops normally. However, when we try to stop it slower by moving the joystick back slower, it recoils backwards after stopping.

This is a graph of the desired speed vs actual speed in AdvantageScope. The left is letting go, the right is trying to stop slowly. IMG_2317 (1) 1920×1440 211 KB

IMG_2317 (1) 1920×1440 211 KB

IMG_2317 (1) 1920×1440 211 KB

The actual speed of each drive motor is overshooting the desired speed.

We tried lowering the P value for drive in YAGSL config, even all the way at 0 it does this same thing. Any ideas on why this might be happening?

This is a video of it happening:

the first few times are letting go, then after that trying to stop slowly shows the recoil.
Here’s the link for our github repo : GitHub - tejparikh4/Mach2025

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked:
Did you change anything from when it was working normally to when it had the recoil?

Edit: I should actually read lol you already answered that.
It worked normally when we simply left the joystick, and it recoiled when we tried to slowly bring it to a stop.

posts.name: Technologyman00
posts.cooked: What does the Rev Hardware client report for PID ?

posts.name: Paul Rensing
posts.cooked: Double check your version of YAGSL . There were control issues with versions 2025.2.0 and earlier. Make sure to be on the latest before testing further.

posts.name: Paul Rensing
posts.cooked:
You seem to be using an old version of YAGSL . They now have a vendordep file which would let you keep up to date, but it might be a significant change from what you are using.

Btw it looks like you could time your speed PID control. It is hard to tell without the hardware, but the graph above looks like it is under tuned.
Somehow, rev hardware client shows all the PID gains as 0
